msg: CAY-1430 Problems with TINYINT type mapping

author: stsp
msg: Make svn patch correctly skip locally deleted targets the patch wants to
edit, and properly replace locally deleted targets the patch adds a new
file on top of. Add a unit test for the latter.
Also do some non-functional refactoring to make the code more readable.
* subversion/libsvn_client/patch.c
(patch_target_t): Replace KIND field (which was used ambiguously) with
DB_KIND and KIND_ON_DISK. Add LOCALLY_DELETED and REPLACED boolean fields.
Remove PARENT_DIR_EXISTS, since the existence of the parent can be checked
on demand.
(resolve_target_path): Track changes to patch_target_t, in particular
initialise new fields. When checking the status of a path, do not error
out if the path doesn't exist. Do not set the kind of non-existent
targets to 'svn_node_file' (this change causes skipped targets to be
reported as 'missing').
(init_patch_target): Do not try to open locally deleted files.
Group initialisation of all fields together in a common code block.
Avoid redundant initialisations; apr_pcalloc() is used so we don't need
to separately initialise pointers to NULL and booleans to FALSE.
(get_hunk_info, apply_hunk): Track changes to patch_target_t.
(send_patch_notification): Send an 'added' notification for replaced
targets for now, since there is no suitable 'replace' notification
we can use (there is "replace during update" but that causes the CLI
client to use a different level of indentation so it looks ugly).
(apply_one_patch): Track changes to patch_target_t and avoid another
redundant initialisation.
(create_missing_parents): New helper function, factored out of ...
(install_patched_target): ... this function to make it more compact.
Stop using PARENT_DIR_EXISTS and check for the parent's existence directly.
Add targets which replaced locally deleted files to version control.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/patch_tests.py
(patch_absolute_paths, patch_add_new_dir): Adjust expected output.
(patch_replace_locally_deleted_file): New.
(test_list): Add new test.

msg: eol-style
